config.question: Which of the following statements is true of the Union war effort?

choices.content: The Union war effort, though well-provisioned and funded, came at the cost of lowered living standards of the civilian population.
The Union forces were largely based on volunteerism and hence they were outnumbered by the Confederate forces.
The northern economy was highly dependent on agriculture to provide for the Union war effort.
Despite some inefficiency, northern factories and farms produced more than enough to provision its troops.

answer_3.response: Consider This: To produce the materials of war, both governments relied mainly on private industry. At the beginning of the Civil War, there were approximately 110,000 factories in the North as compared to 1800 factories in the South. See L.O. 15.2 What challenges did “total war” bring for each side?
